note.text: Discovered from eating peanuts and re-confirmed with allergy test.
Discovered from eating peanuts and re-confirmed with allergy test.
Discovered from eating peanuts and re-confirmed with allergy test.
Discovered from eating peanuts and re-confirmed with allergy test.

reaction.text: Nausea occurs as soon as medication is administered.
Extreme allergy to peanuts. Must carry EPI E-Z PEN at all times in case of exposure.

condition.text: Patient is pregnant with third child.
Patient is monitoring diet to see if they can determine a pattern.

dosageInstruction.instruction: Dose should be taken at same time each day

dosageInstruction.text: Take 5 pills a day at meals

dosageLine.text: A free form description of how the dispensed medication is to be administered to the patient

issue.text: The patient has an intolerance to glucose
The patient has an intolerance to peanuts

managment.text: I told the patient to lay off the glucose
I told the patient to lay off the glucose

GCN_SEQNO.description: FDB GCN_SEQNO - identifies a unique drug formulation. This includes the drugs ACTIVE ingredient(s), strength, dosage form, and route of administration

OPINION.description: Online Product Identification Number Index of Nova Scotia (OPINIONs)

ICD10CA.description: ICD10CA - icd10 Canadian Codes - diagnosis codes and reaction codes

LOINC.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) - used for Allergy Tests, and Observation Type codes

ACTCODE.description: HL7 v3 ActCode - need this for allergies as allergy type can be either ActCode vocab or SNOMED - we support ActCode.

ENTITYCODE.description: HL7v3 EntityCode - need this for allergies for expressing the allergen (NonDrugAgentEntity) as the alternative is SNOMED which we are not supporting.
